fval.name: description
fval.value: Removal of the API and linked objects that were used to secure the Web Service

fval.name: notes
fval.value:
## Input parameters Parameters passed during the API Call: - The name of the organization (instance_id) - The name of the webservice (service_id)
## Performed actions The following objects are removed from API Manager: - The Front-End API (with the name FE_Back-End API name) - The Back-End API (with the name BIC_Web service name) - The application (with the name Front-End API name_App)
## Return message - Message format ``` {} ```
## Curl sample to test the API ``` curl -X DELETE \ ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}:${APIManagerAPIUserPwd} ${baseURLSBAPI}/v2/service_instances/ORGA01/service_bindings/WS1 ``` With: - ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}: the loging of a user granted to access the API - ${APIManagerAPIUserPwd}: the password of the user - ${baseURLSBAPI}: the base URL to access the API (ex:https://api-env.demo.axway.com:8065)

fval.name: reason
fval.value: Gone - The binding does not exist

fval.name: description
fval.value: Name of the Web Service to be unbind

fval.name: description
fval.value: Removal of the organization and Administrator in API Manager

fval.name: notes
fval.value:
## Input parameters Parameters passed during the API Call: - The name of the organization (instance_id)
## Performed actions The organization is removed from API Manager The linked Administrator is automatically deleted from API Manager
## Return message - Message format ``` {} ```
## Curl sample to test the API ``` curl -X DELETE \ ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}:${APIManagerAPIUserPwd} ${baseURLSBAPI}/v2/service_instances/ORGA01 ``` With: - ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}: the loging of a user granted to access the API - ${APIManagerAPIUserPwd}: the password of the user - ${baseURLSBAPI}: the base URL to access the API (ex:https://api-env.demo.axway.com:8065)

fval.name: reason
fval.value: Unprocessable Entity - The broker only supports asynchronous deprovisioning for the requested plan and the request did not include ?accepts_incomplete=true

fval.name: description
fval.value: Organization name to be deleted in API Manager

fval.name: reason
fval.value: Done - The service instance does not exist

fval.name: reason
fval.value: Accepted - Service instance deletion is in progress

fval.name: description
fval.value: List all organizations available in API Manager

fval.name: notes
fval.value:
## Input parameters No parameter
## Performed actions List all organizations available in API Manager
## Return message - Message format ``` [ { "name": "string", "id": "string", "description": "string" } ] ```
- Message sample ``` [ { "name": "FastCars", "id": "4e2490b2-b495-4599-b26e-03b26b9aa25b", "description": "Car Manufacturer" }, { "name": "API Development", "id": "14df2c8b-c28c-4062-ba8b-31449524a611", "description": "API Development team" }, { "name": "HealthMob", "id": "fb452ab9-dba6-4bfe-84e7-40effafd6804", "description": "Partner developing the Patient Care mobile app" } ]```
## Curl sample to test the API ``` curl -i -u ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}:${APIManagerAPIUserPwd} ${baseURLSBAPI}/v2/catalog ``` with: - ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}: the loging of a user granted to access the API - ${APIManagerAPIUserPwd}: the password of the user - ${baseURLSBAPI}: the base URL to access the API (ex:https://api-env.demo.axway.com:8065)

fval.name: description
fval.value: Organization and Administrator provisioning in API Manager

fval.name: notes
fval.value:
## Input parameters Parameters passed during the API Call: - The name of the organization (instance_id) - The name and the email of the administrator (part of the body)
Message body: ``` { "service_id": "string", "plan_id": "string", "organization_guid": "string", "space_guid": "string", "parameters": { "AdminName": "string", "AdminEmail": "string" } } ``` With: - service_id: The ID of the service (from the catalog) // not used - plan_id: The ID of the plan (from the catalog) for which the service instance has been requested // not used - organization_guid: The platform GUID for the organization under which the service is to be provisioned // not used - space_guid: The identifier for the project space within the platform organization // not used - name: name of the organization administrator. Is used as a login in API Manager - AdminEmail: organization administrator email. This email is used to reset the organization administrator password for his first connection to API Manager } }
## Performed actions Several objects are created in API Manager for the provisioning: - An organization (the name of the organization is passed as a parameter of the call) - An organization administrator (name and email are passed in the request body)
An email is then sent to the administrator using his email to reset his password
## Return message - Message format ``` { "dashboard_url": "string" } ```
- Message sample ``` { "dashboard_url": "https://api-env.demo.axway.com:8075/" } ``` ## Curl sample to test the API ``` curl -X PUT \ '${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}:${APIManagerAPIUserPwd} ${baseURLSBAPI}/v2/service_instances/ORGA02?accepts_incomplete=false' \ -H 'content-type: application/json' \ -d '{ "service_id": "id1", "plan_id": "id2", "organization_guid": "id3", "space_guid": "id3", "parameters": { "AdminName": "username", "AdminEmail": "username@companyname.com" } }' ``` With: - ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}: the loging of a user granted to access the API - ${APIManagerAPIUserPwd}: the password of the user - ${baseURLSBAPI}: the base URL to access the API (ex:https://api-env.demo.axway.com:8065)

fval.name: reason
fval.value: A service instance already exists and the requested parameters are identical to the existing service instance

fval.name: reason
fval.value: A service instance with the same id already exists but with different attributes.

fval.name: reason
fval.value: User not found during the organization administrator password initialization

fval.name: reason
fval.value: The broker only supports asynchronous provisioning for the requested plan and the request did not include ?accepts_incomplete=true.

fval.name: reason
fval.value: The service instance was provisioned as a result of this request

fval.name: description
fval.value: Organization name to be created in API Manager

fval.name: description
fval.value: A value of true indicates that the marketplace and its clients support asynchronous broker operations

fval.name: description
fval.value: Implement an API in API Manager to secure the Service provided by a back-End

fval.name: notes
fval.value:
## Input parameters Parameters passed during the API Call: - The name of the organization (instance_id) - The name of the webservice (service_id)
Message body: ``` { "service_id": "string", "plan_id": "string", "bind_resource": { "app_guid": "string" }, "parameters": { "SwaggerURL": "string" } } ``` With: - service_id: The ID of the service (from the catalog) // not used - plan_id: The ID of the plan (from the catalog) for which the service instance has been requested // not used - app_guid: GUID of an application associated with the binding to be created. // Not used - SwaggerURL: URL of the swagger definition of the Web Service
## Performed actions Several objects are created in API Manager for the binding: - A Back-End API: - The name of the Back-End = BIC_Web service name - The Back-End API definition is built via an import of the swagger definition pointed by the URL passed as a parameter of the call - A Front-End API: - The name of the Front-End API = FE_Back-End API name - An application: - The name of the application = Front-End API name_App
## Return message - Message format ``` {} ```
## Curl sample to test the API ``` curl -X PUT \ ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}:${APIManagerAPIUserPwd} ${baseURLSBAPI}/v2/service_instances/ORGA01/service_bindings/WS1 \ -H 'content-type: application/json' \ -d '{ "service_id": "id1", "plan_id": "id2", "bind_resource": { "app_guid": "id3" }, "parameters": { "SwaggerURL": "http://petstore.swagger.io/v2/swagger.json" } }' ``` With: - ${APIManagerAPIUserLogin}: the loging of a user granted to access the API - ${APIManagerAPIUserPwd}: the password of the user - ${baseURLSBAPI}: the base URL to access the API (ex:https://api-env.demo.axway.com:8065)

fval.name: description
fval.value: Name of the Web Service to be bind

fval.name: reason
fval.value: OK - Binding already exists and the requested parameters are identical to the existing binding

fval.name: reason
fval.value: Unprocessable Entity - Should be returned if the broker requires that app_guid be included in the request body
